newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petron to invest $3 bln in refinery.
newsitem.headline: Petron to invest $3 bln in refinery.

text.p: Oil refiner Petron Corp said on Monday it would invest $3 billion in a grassroots refinery and aromatics plant to be located in a new petrochemical park in Bataan, just northwest of Manila.
Petron chairman Monico Jacob told reporters the refinery, with a capacity of 100,000 to 200,000 barrels per day, was expected to be completed by 2001 or 2002.

Jacob was speaking to reporters after a signing ceremony at which Petron agreed to locate the refinery in the new petrochemical park being set up by state-owned Philippine National Oil Co-Petrocemical Development Corp.
Jacob said the aromatics plant to be built with the refinery would produce polyester fibre for textiles. He did not mention how much the plant was expected to produce.

"We are looking at the possibility of entering into a partnership with a refinery operator and an aromatics operator," Jacob said, adding that Petron had considered some foreign companies for a joint venture. Jacob declined to name them.
Petron, the Philippines' leading oil refiner is 40 percent owned by Saudi Arabia's Aramco Oil Co.
